;;2月10日，美国总统乔·拜登和巴西总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦在美国华盛顿走下白宫的柱廊。 2023. Andrew Caballero-Reynolds/Pool via REUTERS/File Photo;
;

;美国总统乔·拜登和巴西总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦将于周三发起一项倡议，以促进劳动人民的权利，美国高级官员表示，这是两位领导人的主要焦点。

;

;拜登政府高级官员表示，美国-巴西工人权利伙伴关系将是双边的，但将鼓励其他国家和组织加入说，但没有透露其他可能的参与者。

;

;拜登和卢拉将于周三在纽约举行年度高级别联合国大会期间举行第二次面对面会议时宣布这一消息。

;

;拜登和卢拉将于周三在纽约举行第二次面对面会议时宣布这一消息。 p>;

;当;卢拉在白宫拜访拜登;时二月，两位领导人重点关注气候危机，并承诺加快保护亚马逊的措施，以及争取和推进民主价值观的必要性。

;

;“这种工人权利伙伴关系是另一个领域一位官员表示，美国和巴西之间以及我们两国总统之间都有明显的亲和力和互补性。”他补充说，拜登和卢拉都拥有“公平、包容性经济增长的共同愿景”和坚定的承诺需要解决的首要问题包括童工、清洁能源和数字经济转型对工人的影响、零工经济以及工作场所对妇女、LGBTQ+ 人群以及种族和民族的歧视另一位官员表示。

;

;两位领导人都计划向 20 国集团（巴西将在 2024 年担任主席）提出这些问题以及全球气候事件。

;

;该公告恰逢;12,700 名美国汽车工人联合会成员举行罢工< /a>; 对抗福特 ;(FN);、通用汽车 ;(GM.N); 和克莱斯勒母公司 Stellantis ;(STLAM.MI); 来敦促他们提高工资和福利的要求。

;

;这标志着美国试图加强与巴西的关系尽管北京和华盛顿之间的紧张局势急剧加剧，但美国仍寻求与其主要贸易伙伴中国保持密切关系。

;

;其中一位官员表示，美国官员非常清楚华盛顿对人类问题的担忧。

;

;该官员补充说，与中国和其他国家建立关系是巴西的主权权利。

;

;一位官员补充道，预计两位领导人还将讨论海地日益严重的人道主义危机，以及肯尼亚提出的领导多国存在以支持改善安全局势的提议。

;

;巴西可以发挥作用这位官员补充道，在让中国和其他联合国安理会成员国了解参与海地事务的重要性方面发挥着重要作用。

;;3 月 9 日，美国副总统乔·拜登在耶路撒冷总理官邸与以色列总理本雅明·内塔尼亚胡（右）共进晚餐， 2010. REUTERS/Baz Ratner/资料图;
;

;美国总统乔·拜登和以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡周三将举行自内塔尼亚胡去年12月上台以来的首次面对面会谈，预计主题将包括潜在的以色列-沙特正常化协议和伊朗。

;

;拜登推迟了;出于对;司法改革;，限制右翼政府的法官权力以及以色列在被占领的约旦河西岸扩建定居点。

;

;而不是在白宫 - 内塔尼亚胡最喜欢的地点 - 两位领导人最终在纽约联合国大会期间安排了会谈。

;

;美国官员预计司法改革也将出现在他们的谈话中作为对抗伊朗核计划的努力以及重大发展的可能性 - 以色列与沙特关系正常化。

;

;鉴于内塔尼亚胡与美国总统打交道的悠久历史，他预计美国会更早访问，但拜登进行了抵制。内塔尼亚胡在2021年拜登入主白宫的头几个月没有获得会面，随后被赶下台。他于去年 12 月重新掌权。

;

;相反，拜登于 7 月欢迎以色列总统艾萨克·赫尔佐格 (Isaac Herzog) 入主白宫，庆祝以色列建国 75 周年。

;

;美国、以色列和沙特阿拉伯一直在讨论一项潜在协议，其中以色列和沙特将实现外交关系正常化，华盛顿和利雅得将就防务协议达成一致，但谈判仍有很长的路要走。

;

;华盛顿近东政策研究所的长期中东观察家戴维·马科夫斯基（David Makovsky）在 X（前身为 Twitter）上发帖指出，这次会议“将在内塔尼亚胡上任 265 天后举行，这是自内塔尼亚胡上任以来最长的一次间隔” 1964 年。”

;

;“沙特协议的巨大潜力让拜登和内塔尼亚胡别无选择，只能不顾分歧进行会面，”他说。

;

;拜登政府;计算;美国可以从中获得巨大回报如果能够克服巨大的障碍，这将是一笔巨大的交易。

;

;“正常化途径的许多要素现在都已摆在桌面上。我们没有框架，也没有准备好签署的条款。还有工作要做。”白宫国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文 9 月 7 日对记者表示。

;

;美国官员并未排除拜登和内塔尼亚胡最终在白宫会面的可能性。

; Wed, 20 Sep 2023 17:25:04 +0800 US attorney general to tell House Republicans: “I am not Congress“s prosecutor“https://reuters.com/article/usa-justice-garland/us-attorney-general-to-tell-house-republicans-i-am-not-congresss-prosecutor-idUSKBN30Q0NK

;;美国司法部长梅里克·加兰宣布任命特别检察官大卫·韦斯，负责对美国总统乔·拜登之子亨特·拜登的持续调查， 2023 年 8 月 11 日在美国华盛顿司法部发表的简短声明中。路透社/邦妮·卡什/档案照片;
;

;美国司法部长梅里克·加兰 (Merrick Garland) 计划告诉共和党控制的美国众议院周三的众议院委员会表示，他管理着一个非政治部门，不听从总统或立法者的命令。

;

;周三听证会前他准备好的讲话摘录表明，加兰已准备好反击立法者他们批评司法部处理共和党;唐纳德·特朗普; 和民主党总统乔·拜登的儿子 ;亨特·拜登;。

;

;“我们的工作不是接受总统、国会或其他任何人的命令，对谁或什么进行刑事调查，”加兰计划告诉一位众议院司法委员会听证会将于美国东部时间上午 10 点（格林尼治标准时间 1400）开始。 “我不是总统的律师。我还要补充一点，我不是国会的检察官。司法部是为美国人民服务的。”

;

;这将是加兰自两个历史性第一以来在国会首次作证：美国司法部对美国前总统特朗普和现任总统的成年子女提出刑事指控。

;

;一周前，共和党领导的众议院发起了一项;对老拜登进行弹劾调查;，涉及亨特·拜登的海外商业交易。白宫驳回了这项调查，称其出于政治动机且未经证实。

;

;特别顾问;去年秋天由加兰任命的杰克·史密斯;已两次因特朗普涉嫌不当处理机密记录以及涉嫌试图推翻 2020 年选举结果而受到起诉总统选举。

;

;作为 2024 年共和党提名的领跑者，特朗普对这些指控以及他在纽约和佐治亚州面临的另外两项刑事起诉表示不认罪。

;

;特朗普多次口头攻击史密斯、潜在证人以及主持颠覆选举案的美国地区法官塔尼娅·查特坎(Tanya Chutkan)，称他面临的起诉是出于政治动机。

;

;共和党人也对该部门的处理方式提出批评对 53 岁的亨特·拜登进行为期五年的税务调查。

;

;小拜登将于 7 月承认两项轻罪税罪，并同意参加一项避免枪支指控的计划与当时的特拉华州美国检察官 ;David Weiss; 达成的协议的一部分.

;

;在一名联邦法官质疑其条款后，该交易宣告失败。在共和党的批评越来越多的情况下，加兰任命韦斯为特别检察官，以便他能够继续调查，并可能在其他联邦地区追究税务指控。

;

;韦斯办公室本月对亨特·拜登提出三项与购买和销售相关的罪名。他在使用非法毒品时持有枪支。亨特·拜登打算不认罪。

;

;加兰周三计划为该部门的职业检察官辩护，这些检察官有时因工作而面临威胁。

;

;“专门针对个别职业公务员只做自己工作的人是危险的，”加兰计划说。 “我们不会被吓倒。”

;;周三官方数据显示，英国8月份年度消费者价格通胀意外降至6.7%，而前一天英国央行预计将再次加息。弗朗西斯·马奎尔报道。;
;;
;< Small style="color: #999;">;2022 年 6 月 27 日，英国伦敦西部里士满，一名员工在 Sainsbury's 超市内摆放农产品。照片摄于 2022 年 6 月 27 日。REUTERS/Henry Nicholls;
;

;英国高通胀率意外下降，促使投资者加大押注英国央行最早将于周四暂停长期加息。

;

;官方数据显示消费者物价指数降至8 月份为 6.7%，为 2022 年 2 月以来的最低水平，低于 7 月份的 6.8%，与路透社和英国央行调查的经济学家对增长的预测相混淆。

;

;英镑兑美元汇率下跌 0.5 美分，跌至最低水平自 5 月份以来，美元兑欧元汇率也因通胀基本指标大幅疲软而下跌。

;

;投资者将近;自 2021 年 12 月以来连续 14 次加息后，英国央行周四维持利率不变的可能性为 50-50; .

;

;国家统计局表示，通胀放缓的原因是经常波动的酒店价格和机票价格下降，以及不到一年前食品价格上涨。

;

;这抵消了全球燃油价格上涨和酒精饮料税增加的影响。

;

;投资者绝大多数;预计英国央行周四再次加息;，将银行利率从 5.25% 提高至 5.5%，尽管 ;英国经济放缓迹象;加剧。;

;在通胀数据公布后，这一情况看起来不太确定。

;

;格林尼治标准时间 0800，投资者认为英国央行在 9 月会议上暂停加息的可能性约为 45%，高于大约 20% % 周二。

;

;“周四的英格兰银行会议变得更加有趣，”荷兰国际集团 (ING) 经济学家詹姆斯·史密斯 (James Smith) 表示。 “这是一个非常接近的机会，但我们仍然想说央行明天将加息。”

;

;他表示，预期的加息可能是英国央行目前最后一次加息。

;

; p>;

;英国毕马威首席经济学家耶尔·塞尔芬 (Yael Selfin) 表示，近期石油价格上涨以及食品价格的潜在压力将给英国央行带来压力。

;

;“这些不仅可能进一步减缓通货紧缩进程，扭转通胀预期下降的趋势，引发英国央行进一步担忧。

;

;上周，欧洲央行;将利率提高至历史新高;，但表明利率可能会暂停。预计美联储将;维持利率不变周三保持不变。

;

;英国通胀率仍然很高，8 月份西欧国家中仅次于奥地利和冰岛。

;

;经济合作与发展组织表示周二，英国;继续保持路线; 2023 年主要富裕经济体的最高通胀率。

;

;但周三的数据显示，核心通胀率（剔除波动较大的食品和能源价格）从 7 月份的 6.9% 意外大幅下降至 6.2%。

;

;英国央行密切关注的服务业通胀也失去了一些动力，从 7 月份的 7.4% 放缓至 6.8%。

;

;单独的数据显示，英国央行还有进一步令人鼓舞的消息;付费交易;失去了更多的通胀热度。;

;英国央行在去年 10 月通胀超过 11% 时受到批评，这不仅让英国央行松了一口气，最新数据也受到了总理里希·苏纳克 (Rishi Sunak) 政府的欢迎。他承诺在 2024 年大选之前将今年的通胀率降低一半。

;

;“今天的新闻表明，应对通胀的计划正在发挥作用 - 简单明了，”财政部长杰里米·亨特 (Jeremy Hunt) 表示。

;

;“但它仍然太高，这就是为什么坚持我们将其减半的计划更加重要，这样我们就可以减轻家庭和企业的压力。”

;

;他说英国可以无力继续“借贷狂欢”，这是对民意调查中民调高涨的反对党工党的猛烈抨击。

;

;随着工厂出厂价格下跌，有迹象表明未来通胀压力将进一步减弱截至 8 月的 12 个月内增长了 0.4%。制造商投入价格下降2.3%。

;A Huawei Technologies unit is shipping new Chinese-made chips for surveillance cameras in a fresh sign the Chinese tech giant is finding ways around four years of US export controls, two sources briefed on the unit's efforts said.

;

;The shipments to surveillance camera manufacturers from the company's HiSilicon chip design unit started this year, according to one of the sources, and a third source familiar with the industry supply chain. One of the sources briefed on the unit said at least some of the customers were Chinese.

;

;Hauwei also unveiled new smartphones in recent weeks that use advanced chips, which analysts say are ;domestically made;. The developments indicate the Chinese tech giant is overcoming Washington's export controls, which since 2019 have barred it from obtaining components and technology from US firms without approval.

;

;"These surveillance chips are relatively easy to manufacture compared to smartphone processors," said the source familiar with the surveillance camera industry's supply chain, adding that HiSilicon's return would shake up the market.

;

;A key factor is that the company appears to have worked around US restrictions on chip design software. Huawei in March announced it had made ;breakthroughs; in design tools for chips produced at and above 14 nanometres - two to three generations behind leading-edge technology, but an advance for the company.

;

;HiSilicon mainly supplies chips for Huawei equipment but has had external customers such as Dahua Technology ;(002236.SZ); and Hikvision ;(002415.SZ);. Before the US export controls, it was the dominant chip supplier to the surveillance camera sector, with brokerage Southwest Securities estimating its global share in 2018 at 60%.

;

;By 2021, HiSilicon's global market share plummeted to just 3.9%, according to data from consulting firm Frost & Sullivan.

;

;One of the sources briefed on the unit's efforts said that HiSilicon had shipped some low-end surveillance chips since 2019 but that its focus was on the high-end arena and reclaiming market share from the likes of Taiwan's Novatek Microelectronics Corp ;(3034.TW);.

;

;All three sources declined to be named because of the sensitivity of the matter.

;

;Huawei declined to comment.

;

;Huawei drew attention in late August when it rolled out the Mate 60 Pro, a ;new smartphone; that uses an advanced chip and that users said was capable of 5G speeds. The event was cheered by Chinese state media and the public as a comeback for Huawei's smartphone business after it was crippled by the US sanctions.

;

;Research firm TechInsights, which examined the Mate 60 Pro, found that it was powered by a new Kirin 9000S, an advanced chip it said was most likely made in China by China's top chip foundry, Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC) ;(0981.HK);.

;

;Huawei has not commented on the phone's 5G capabilities or how it produced the advanced chip. The Kirin series has historically been designed by HiSilicon, and before the US sanctions Huawei, worked with Taiwan's TSMC ;(2330.TW); to manufacture it.

;

;The launch prompted ;calls from; US lawmakers to put additional pressure and "more effective export controls" on Huawei and China's top chip foundry, Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC) ;(0981.HK);.

;

;The United States has no evidence that Huawei can produce smartphones with advanced chips in large volumes, US Commerce Secretary ;Gina Raimondo said; on Tuesday.

;

;The US sanctions have strangled HiSilicon's access to electronic design automation (EDA) software from Cadence Design Systems Inc ;(CDNS.O); and Synopsys Inc ;(SNPS.O);, and Siemens AG's ;(SIEGn.DE); Mentor Graphics. The three companies' products dominate the chip-design sector, which produces blueprints for chips before they are mass manufactured.

;

;TechInsights analyst Dan Hutcheson said their analysis of the Mate 60 Pro and other components such as its radio frequency power chip also suggested that Huawei had access to sophisticated EDA tools that "they are not supposed to have".

;

;"We don't know if they got them illicitly, or more probably the Chinese developed their own EDA tools," he said.

;Azerbaijan on Wednesday pounded Nagorno-Karabakh, a breakaway region controlled by ethnic Armenians, despite calls from Russia and the United States for both sides to halt a spiral into war.

;

;Azerbaijan began its "anti-terrorist" ;operation; on Tuesday against Nagorno-Karabakh after some of its troops were killed in what Baku said were attacks from the mountainous region. Karabakh is recognised internationally as part of Azerbaijan.

;

;Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan said Karabakh was being shelled intensively in an attempt to provoke a war. He demanded that Russian peacekeepers do their job and warned that unidentified forces were talking about a coup in Yerevan.

;

;Ethnic Armenians in Karabakh said Azerbaijan had triggered a new war against the 120,000 people living in an area they consider their homeland. Nearby Turkey backed Azerbaijan, with which it has strong linguistic, cultural and economic ties.

;

;US Secretary of State Antony Blinken urged Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev to "immediately cease hostilities" and told Pashinyan that Washington supported Armenia's sovereignty and territorial integrity.

;

;Russia - distracted by the war in Ukraine - also called for calm but some Russian officials scolded Armenia for flirting with the West and said this could lead to serious problems.

;

;"We urge the conflicting parties to immediately stop the bloodshed, stop hostilities and eliminate civilian casualties," Russia's foreign ministry said in a statement posted on its Telegram messaging platform.

;

;Another war in the former Soviet Union could disrupt the geopolitical balance in the South Caucasus, an area where Russia, the United States, Turkey and Iran are jostling for influence.

;

;Azerbaijan's defence ministry said on Wednesday that military measures "continue successfully", with weaponry and military equipment destroyed.

;

;Armenians in Karabakh, known by Armenians as Artsakh, said fighting was continuing with varying intensity. At least 27 people have been killed in Karabakh and 200 wounded, they said. Residents of some villages have been evacuated, they said.

;

;Russian news agencies cited the Azeri presidential administration as saying Aliyev had told Blinken that Azerbaijan would halt its operation only after Armenian fighters lay down their weapons and surrender.

;

;Azerbaijan said its intention was to "disarm and secure the withdrawal of formations of Armenia's armed forces from our territories, (and) neutralise their military infrastructure".

;

;Antonio Guterres, Secretary-General of the United Nations, called "for an immediate end to the fighting" after the European Union, France and Germany condemned Baku's military action.

;

;As the Soviet Union crumbled, what is known as the First Karabakh War erupted (1988-1994) between Armenians and their Azeri neighbours. About 30,000 people were killed and more than a million people displaced.

;

;In 2020, after decades of skirmishes, energy-rich Azerbaijan began a military operation which became the Second Karabakh War, swiftly breaking through Armenian defences.

;

;Azerbaijan, backed by Turkey, won a resounding victory in the 44-day war, taking back parts of Karabakh. Russia brokered a ceasefire then - and has called for both sides to return to it.

;

;But Armenia has accused Moscow of being too distracted by its own war in Ukraine to protect it and said Russian peacekeepers in Karabakh were failing to do their job.

;

;Protesters unhappy about what they saw as Moscow's failure to stop Azerbaijan chanted anti-Russian slogans outside Russia's embassy in Armenia on Tuesday evening, Russia's state TASS news agency reported.

;

;"We should not allow some people, some forces, external and internal, to put Armenia's statehood under attack," Pashinyan said in a national address on Tuesday.

;

;"I have to record that, as expected, calls for a coup d'état are already being heard from different places, even in Armenia."
